Intervention: From 2 to 4 weeks after the end of the lumpectomy, patients receive food booklets to be completed for 7 to 10 days. Dietary counsellors then give patients directions for dietary changes in order to reduce the calorie intake by 25% of their normal diet. Patients follow a limited calorie diet for 10 weeks (2 weeks before radiation therapy, 6 weeks of radiation therapy and at least 2 weeks after radiation therapy).
A behavioral diet intervention: receiving a restricted calorie diet intervention
Conventional Therapeutic Surgery: A Definitive Lumpectomy
Quality of Life Assessment: Auxiliary Studies
Eligibility: Incorporation criteria:
• Pathologically proven diagnosis of in situ channel carcinoma (CDIS) or invasive breast cancer

The ability to have breast conservation as determined by the judgement of the radiation oncologist, for which the radiation oncologist has determined that he will treat only the whole breast and not the regional lymph nodes
The patient must be a woman.
Age >= 18
If multifocal breast cancer, then it must be able to be resequently by a single lumpectomy incision
Appropriate step for protocol entry, including lack of clinical data on distant metastases, based on the following minimum diagnostic study:
History/physical examination, including breast examination and documentation of weight and performance status of Karnofsky from 80 to 100% for at least 60 days prior to entry into the study
• Ipsilateral mammography within 6 months of entry into the study
Women of childbearing potential must undergo a negative serum pregnancy test within 14 days of entry into the study.
Women of childbearing potential should be non-pregnant and non-native and willing to use a medically acceptable form of contraception during radiotherapy.
The patient must be able to obtain and provide specific informed consent to the study prior to entry into the study.
Body Mass Index (BMI) >= 21
Weight >= 100 lbs
No history of non-brain malignant tumours in the past two years unless it is a skin injury or non-melanomatous carcinoma in situ of the cervix
The patient should not have the following severe and active co-morbidity, defined as:
• Unstable angina and/or congestive heart failure requiring hospitalization in the last 6 months
Infarction of the transmural myocardial system in the last 6 months
• Acute bacterial or fungal infection requiring intravenous antibiotics at the time of registration
The exacerbation of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease or any other respiratory disease requiring hospitalization or excluding study treatment within 30 days of registration
However, laboratory tests are not required to determine liver function and coagulation parameters for entry into this protocol.

However, it should be noted that HIV testing is not necessary for entry into this protocol; the need to exclude patients with AIDS or HIV from this protocol is necessary because antiretrovirals can alter the patient's metabolism.
The patient should not have lupus, erythematosus or history of scleroderma, dermatomyosis with active rash.
No previous ipsilateral radiotherapy or radiotherapy prior to the breast region that would result in overlapping fields of radiation therapy
The patient may not have any gastrointestinal disorder/active malabsorption at the discretion of the Principal Investigator.
